name: crocodile
content:
crocodile noun [C]
(ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 (informal croc, uk
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/krɒk/ us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/krɑːk/) a large reptile with a hard skin that lives in and near rivers and lakes in hot, wet parts of the world. It is like an alligator, but it usually has a longer and narrower nose: a crocodile-infested swamp
tttuna/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHumans, dogs, elephants and dolphins are all mammals, but birds, fish and crocodiles are not.On average, two crocodiles a year end up as road kill on Florida's Highway 1.He lost an arm to a crocodile.

crocodile noun [C]
(LINE)
UK informal a line of people, especially children, who are walking in pairs

a large, hard-skinned reptile (= type of animal) with a longer and narrower nose than that of an alligator which lives in and near rivers and lakes in hot, wet places
